intro: Gongylolepis benthamiana var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy gongylolepis, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving it the "hairy" descriptor in its scientific name. The flowers, which are usually pink or purple, are clustered in whorls and attract various pollinators.
